messages.content:
Extract a list of all organizations, companies, institutions, and other entities mentioned in this article. You must exclude all real people from your output, it should only list organizations, companies, institutions, excluding people.

Requirements:
1. Include all types of organizations (companies, government agencies, NGOs, etc.)
2. Only include entities that are actually discussed, not just mentioned in passing
3. Remove any duplicates
4. Include full official names where possible.
5. Do not include broad terms like "government" or "companies" without specific identifiers or a specific organisation.
6. DO NOT include people.
7. Limit the Organisation name (**ENTITY**) to a maximum of 3 to 4 words.
8. The entity name MUST NOT be empty - if you can't identify the name, skip that entity entirely.

Article:
Title: EMR Capital chooses not to participate in 29Metals' $150m equity raising - DATA ROOM
Content: Page 1 of 2
EMR Capital chooses not to participate in 29Metals' $150m equity raising - DATA ROOM
EMR Capital chooses not to participate in 29Metals' $150m equity raising - 
DATA ROOM
The Australian
December 4, 2024 Wednesday
Australian Edition
Copyright 2024 Nationwide News Pty Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: BUSINESS; Pg. 14
Length: 341 words
Byline: EDITED BY BRIDGET CARTER
Body
EMR Capital, the 45 per cent shareholder of 29Metals, has opted out of participating in its latest $180m equity 
raising.
It would secure $47m of the funds through a placement and the rest through an entitlement offer. The copper miner 
remained in a trading halt on Tuesday as advisers at Macquarie Capital moved to find more funds for the group.
29Metals has struggled with flooding at its Capricorn Copper project in Queensland and disappointing production 
and said the funds were being used to pay down $US18m of debt and refinance, fund its Gossan Valley 
development to first ore and reduce water levels at Capricorn Copper.
AustralianSuper's share would move to 18 per cent and. BUMA would hold 19.9 per cent after taking up their rights 
to participate in the offer. 29Metals listed at $2 a share in 2021 and its market value is now $260m.
There had been speculation that the private equity firm EMR Capital had been keen to sell out of the company and 
had tested buyer interest.
DataRoom reported in October another raising was on the cards after it tapped the market last year through 
Macquarie and Jarden.
29Metals also owns the Golden Grove copper and gold mine in Western Australia. Analysts at Jarden had forecast 
a cash balance of $30m at December, assuming all loans are full drawn, and they said they remained of the view 
that additional funds were needed.
They pointed out that its cash balance had reduced to about $60m, from $85m at June, and its liquidity had fallen to 
about $104m, from about $130m, as net debt increased to $147m.
In August last year, the company raised $151m at 69c a share, an 8 per cent discount to the last closing share price 
of 75c.
Page 2 of 2
EMR Capital chooses not to participate in 29Metals' $150m equity raising - DATA ROOM
Spartan Resources Meanwhile, Ramelius Resources is believed to be participating in the Spartan Resources 
equity raising, adding to speculation it remains keen for a buyout.
The move will take its interest in the company to 19.9 per cent, say sources. Spartan entered a trading halt on 
Tuesday as it taps the market for $220m by way of a placement at $1.32 per share through Canaccord.
Load-Date: December 3, 2024
End of Document

Output Format:
**ENTITY**: [Organization Name]
**TYPE**: [Type of organization - e.g., Company, Government Agency, NGO, etc.]
**DESCRIPTION**: [Brief description of how the entity is discussed in the article]

Example Output:
**ENTITY**: Tesla, Inc.
**TYPE**: Company
**DESCRIPTION**: Main subject of article, discussing Q4 earnings report

Only include entities that are meaningful to the article's content. Return "None" in case there are no relevant organisations to be mentioned.
You must exclude Ramelius Resources from your output.

**ENTITY**: EMR Capital  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: A private equity firm that is a 45% shareholder of 29Metals and opted out of participating in its equity raising.

**ENTITY**: 29Metals  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: A copper miner involved in an equity raising and facing challenges with flooding and production issues.

**ENTITY**: Macquarie Capital  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: Advisers helping 29Metals find more funds for its operations.

**ENTITY**: AustralianSuper  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: A superannuation fund that holds shares in 29Metals and is mentioned in relation to its shareholding.

**ENTITY**: BUMA  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: An entity that holds shares in 29Metals and is participating in the equity raising.

**ENTITY**: Jarden  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: Analysts providing forecasts and insights regarding 29Metals' financial situation.

**ENTITY**: Spartan Resources  
**TYPE**: Company  
**DESCRIPTION**: A company involved in an equity raising and speculated to be keen for a buyout.
